channel.title: Xp vs Vista
channel.description: well i was juss wondering whatss like the main differences between XP and Vista..?? cause i had to do a presentation on this and i juss wanted to know what 3 major topics and subheadings i should put into my presentation..? i was thinkin of like user interface and security.... anyone else got any good ideass that i can also use. thankss :)

item.title: Xp vs Vista
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

I loved XP for years, and still do theres nothing wrong with it, except i like being updated.

Currently using a lite version of windows vista ultimate, 700mb all the shit ripped out, set bare.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp vs Vista
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:21, topic:261214”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=344958.msg2661033#msg2661033 date=1234199543]
I prefer vista, XP is old.
[/quote]

Which means it is the safest and has the most security updates.

Even though I’m pretty much anti-Microsoft, I try to keep an open mind about these types of debates. Tbh, XP is better than Vista just because of the security and the support. You should add Windows 7 to the options, as it outstrips Vista by a mile. Even though it is the same core, Microsoft removed most of the shit (2gb worth) and fixed their program waiting system. Windows 7 is practically as fast as XP with the features of Vista. It’s the way to go, even though it’s in beta.[/quote]I agree Windows 7 is better, but it won’t be on release. It will be just as bloated as Vista by then.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp vs Vista
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Ollie:

I prefer vista, XP is old.

Which means it is the safest and has the most security updates.

Even though I’m pretty much anti-Microsoft, I try to keep an open mind about these types of debates. Tbh, XP is better than Vista just because of the security and the support. You should add Windows 7 to the options, as it outstrips Vista by a mile. Even though it is the same core, Microsoft removed most of the shit (2gb worth) and fixed their program waiting system. Windows 7 is practically as fast as XP with the features of Vista. It’s the way to go, even though it’s in beta.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp vs Vista
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

darkilla:

like windows defender and all the extra stuff vista has like the firewall n everything… but i need one more topic to talk about also…

No its fine,
But those just come with the computer, you can’t expect them to be AMAZING. (None of them are though) I suggest using nothing. I had vista for a year no anti virus (too lazy to get) and never got a virus. Just have to be careful, and if it looks like a virus… It probably is.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp vs Vista
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:13, topic:261214”][quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=344958.msg2661124#msg2661124 date=1234206362]

I don’t think that Vista is all that bad. It’s the bad publicity that surrounds it that makes it look bad.

I had vista for a year it worked fine, until two months ago. It would freeze so many times when I was doing one thing, the drivers got fucked up and it wouldnt let me open mozilla. Nothing on the command prompt worked properly, it just went to shits and I went to linux.
[/quote]

If it worked fine for a year, don’t you think something else fucked everything up? I guess a reinstall would suffice.[/quote]
I did, and within another month it just fucked up again so I don’t really know what happened but im satisfied with linux

Read full topic

item.title: Xp vs Vista
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

With SP1 Vista runs fine and the driver support is nearly as good as XP. I wouldn’t recommend it unless you have alot of RAM though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Well XP > Vitsa.

Vista may look nice but all of that “beauty” can be appiled to XP and vista has serious driver issues! Worst of all just like all Winblows OSs more CPU and more RAM is needed for thing to just sit there! The Minimum requirements leaped a mile with the introduction of Vista. 4 times more RAM!
